para.para.body: When a force acts on an object, it does so in a certain direction and with a certain strength. As is illustrated below, we can model a force using a vector.

Here an object is suspended on a rope. We model the downward force of 1000N, corresponding to the weight of the object, by a downward arrow whose length corresponds to the magnitude of the force of 1000N. Accordingly, the vector representing a downward force of 2000N would be twice as long. The vector representing a downward force of 500N half as long; etc.

To hold the object in suspense, the downward force must be compensated by an upward force of equal magnitude. This upward force results from two forces, denoted F_1 and F_2 , sidewards upward in the rope. The magnitude of these forces can be computed with elementary geometric methods.
